meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'spectacles', meaning eyeglasses.
meanings.sent1: She always wears her spects to read books.
meanings.sent2: He bought new spects to see clearly.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried on tiny spects and looked quite serious.
meanings.sent4: His spects revealed a world of details he had never noticed before.
meanings.sent5: The shiny spects sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'spectacles', meaning a pair of lenses set in a frame worn on the nose and ears to correct vision or protect the eyes.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa's spects help him see better.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned her spects before the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to wear the cat's spects and bumped into walls.
meanings.sent4: Her spects shielded her eyes from the bright sun.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's spects magnified the tiny details of the specimen.

meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'spectacles', meaning an event or scene regarded in terms of its visual impact.
meanings.sent1: The concert was a spects of lights and music.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was a beautiful spects in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The spects of the clown juggling bananas made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at sunset was a breathtaking spects.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition was a colorful spects of creativity.
